text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm rob a principal consultant
here at the AWS office in Northern
Virginia
today I'm going to show you how to
reduce your Amazon Route 53 costs let's
get started here's how you can cut Route
53 costs that are higher than expected
delete unwanted hosted zones
there's a monthly charge for each hosted
Zone created in Route 53 so be sure to
delete any hosted zones that you don't
need or use sign in to the AWS
Management console and then open the
Route 53 console
in the navigation pane choose hosted
zones and then choose a highlighted link
for the hosted Zone that you want to
delete
confirm that the hosted Zone that you
want to delete contains only NS and SOA
records if it contains additional
records be sure to delete those first
if applicable verify that DNS X signing
is turned off on the hosted Zone
choose delete Zone
enter the confirmation and choose delete
next we're going to take a look at using
Alias records there's a charge for most
DNS queries answered by Route 53 but
queries to Alias records mapped to
resources are free of charge from the
Route 53 console in the navigation pane
choose hosted zones
choose the name of the hosted Zone that
you want to use to route
choose the create record button to add a
DNS record
specify your preferred values for
routing policy and record name
choose the domain name of the
application or AWS service that you want
to Route traffic to and accept the
default record type here I'm going to
route to an AWS application load
balancer
accept the default value for evaluate
Target health and choose create records
you can also use a higher TTL to save
costs configuring a higher TTL or time
to live for your records reduces your
charges because the intermediate
resolvers cash the records for a longer
period of time
from the Route 53 console choose hosted
zones in the navigation Pane and then
choose the name of the hosted Zone
choose the NS record
and then choose edit record
change the value of TTL here I'm going
to double my current setting and then
choose save
another way to reduce cost is to replace
your traffic policy review your traffic
policy records and then replace with
simple records or other routing policies
to reduce costs
from the Route 53 console in the
navigation pane choose policy records
on the policy records page select the
check box for the policy record that you
want to update and then choose edit
policy record in this case I could
replace this policy with an alias record
like I did previously
an additional way to save costs with
Route 53 is to share your resolver
endpoints a Route 53 endpoint resolver
uses two or more IP addresses
each IP address is associated with one
elastic network interface and costs 12
and a half cents per hour you can reduce
your costs by using a single outbound
endpoint across multiple Amazon virtual
private clouds
from the Route 53 console in the
navigation pane choose outbound
endpoints
click the ID of an existing outbound
endpoint
click on create rule
associate the endpoint with another VPC
and enter the appropriate Target IP
address I'm going to create a new rule
but first I'm going to give it a name in
this case I'm calling it new rule test
I'll give it a domain name
new outbound rule.com
I've already Associated this endpoint
with another VPC so I'm going to drop
this list down and choose yet a
different VPC I need to provide a Target
IP address
in this case
I will enter the value and when you're
satisfied with the settings choose
submit
you can also replace your health checks
health checks are charged based on their
Associated endpoints it's a best
practice to delete any unused health
checks if you want to run a health check
then follow these steps you can use a
resource record set instead of a health
check a zero charge or you can evaluate
your target Health whenever possible as
an alternative
from the Route 53 console in the
navigation pane choose health checks
to update an existing health check
select the health check and then choose
edit health check
here you can replace the health check
with a resource record
one final way to reduce costs in Route
53 is to delete health checks
from the Route 53 console in the
navigation pane choose health checks
in the right pane select the health
check that you want to delete
choose delete health check
choose confirm
and now you know how to reduce your
Route 53 costs
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
foreign
[Music]
